internal.content:
<PageDescription>

Deep Search technologies are used by IBM partners across industries.
These partners choose and deploy our modular services according to their needs.

</PageDescription>

## Watson Discovery

<Row>
<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

[Watson Discovery](https://www.ibm.com/cloud/watson-discovery) is a search
and text-analytics platform that retrieves information buried inside
enterprise data. It uses natural language processing to get insights from
documents and webpages. Here the Deep Search parsing service is used as one
of the first document processing steps.

</Column>

<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

![Watson Discovery](images/watson-discovery.png)

</Column>
</Row>

## NAGASE TABRASA

<Row>
<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

[NAGASE](https://www.nagase.co.jp) specializes in the production, trade, and R&D of a wide range of materials, from raw materials for plastics to functional food ingredients and pharmaceutical intermediates.
NAGASE also provides its expertise to clients, including the digitization of materials discovery.
To this end NAGASE and IBM Research have developed a material discovery platform [TABRASA](https://tabrasa.jp) that runs on top of the full range of Deep Search technologies.

</Column>

<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

![TABRASA](images/tabrasa.png)

</Column>
</Row>

## Eni

<Row>
<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

[Eni](https://www.eni.com) is one of the "supermajor" oil companies and depends on hydrocarbon exploration to maintain its supply.
To explore a potential source of hydrocarbons, a basin, geoscientists analyse large document collections from many sources.
[Eni and IBM work together](https://www.ibm.com/blogs/research/2019/06/eni-ibm-geological-data) on a Cognitive Discovery platform to parse and integrate these document sources into knowledge graphs.
[Eni's Cognitive Discovery](https://www.eni.com/en-IT/media/press-release/2019/06/eni-and-ibm-boost-geological-data-interpretation-thanks-to-artificial-intelligence-platform.html) runs on an IBM Power 9 super computer, installed on premises in the Eni Green Data Center in Ferrera Erbognone, Pavia, Italy.

</Column>

<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

![Eni](images/eni.jpg)

</Column>
</Row>

## Wintershall Dea

<Row>
<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

[Wintershall Dea](https://wintershalldea.com) is a gas an oil producer that depends on geologists to search for new hydrocarbon sources.
Wintershall and IBM have developed the [Exploration Advisor Tool](https://www.ibm.com/blogs/client-voices/ai-helps-exploration-geologists-improve-predictions) to accelerate this search.
This tool serves as an intelligent search engine for geologists by analyzing large document collections.

</Column>

<Column colMd={6} colLg={6}>

![Eni](images/wintershall.jpg)

</Column>
</Row>
